title: Missing 10-year-old boy found safe at Durham hotel, Cary police say :: WRAL.com
text:
Missing 10-year-old boy found safe at Durham hotel, Cary police say 
Posted 37 minutes ago Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters More on this Find News Near Me 
Morrisville, N.C. â€” A 10-year-old boy who went missing from school on Monday was found safe at a Durham hotel and returned to his mother early Tuesday morning, according to Cary police. 
Khristian Joseph was last seen at 3:45 p.m. as he was leaving Pleasant Grove Elementary School on foot. Joseph is usually picked up in front of the school by a relative and does not walk home or ride the bus. 
Durham police were called to the Sleep Inn hotel at 5208 Page Road after a hotel employee found Joseph by himself. Durham officers notified the Cary police department around 4:45 a.m. Tuesday, and Joseph was returned safely to his mother half an hour later. 
Authorities focused their search Monday night around the school and the woods behind it after Joseph was seen on surveillance video walking toward the woods. Police K-9 officers and fire department personnel assisted in the search. Credits
